lang.text: This unit can only sprint so far.
Valid Target, But Out Of Range
Valid Target, But Your Unit Is Out Of AP
Valid Target, But You Are Out Of Mental Energy
Your unit needs to move near the target, but there is no space for that.
Your shell company units cannot talk to this target.
Your PMC Impostors cannot talk to this target.
Only a PMC Impostor can talk to this target.
Only a unit from your shell company can talk to this target.
It's not clear what kind of unit can talk to this target.
Your unit will be exposed and helpless for three turns.
Your unit will be silent and hidden for six turns.
Another Unit Is In Your Way
They might move on their own, maybe.
You should get it out of the way.

lang.translation_notes: Header on its own line for a description of what action will be taken when the player moves where they are indicating.

lang.text: This unit's drones can only reach so far.
This item can only be used on targets within this unit's attack range.
The amount of morale damage that will be inflicted on the target now and again each turn. It's the combination of your unit's power and intimidation. It bypasses both bravery and stubbornness.
This target cannot be forced into any conversations at the moment.
This target cannot have its comms probed.
This target cannot be set on fire.
Your units cannot leave this lockdown area unless they are cloaked.
Your units cannot enter this lockdown area unless they are cloaked.
Your units cannot enter or exit this lockdown area unless they are cloaked.
Selected unit is already in this vehicle.
Vehicle has no space for this kind of passenger.
This vehicle can carry this type of unit, but all matching slots are full.
This vehicle has no slots for this kind of passenger.
This unit cannot attack that far away. Either move closer, or consider a weapon upgrade.
You cannot sell fewer than {0} units at a time.
lang.translation_notes: {0} is an integer number, and the units is units of some resource -- a metal, a food, a liquid, who knows.

lang.text: Only one unit can occupy a building at a time.
If you have enough Mental Energy remaining, you can convert some of it into Action Points by using the Battle Recharge ability.

This unit cannot safely move to that spot. It may be able to move close to that spot. Alternatively, you can change the unit into Combat stance. Then it can move wherever you like -- it might get shot, though.
This android is moving very fast, requiring extra Mental Energy but not extra Action Points (AP).
This squad is moving very fast, requiring extra Mental Energy.
This mech is moving very fast, requiring extra Mental Energy.
There are other things you need to do first.
Units can be carried long distances in vehicles.
Bulk android squads cannot ride in vehicles.
Bulk android squads are great for holding territory and projecting force, but they are slow to move from place to place.
Captured units cannot ride in vehicles.
Captured units are excellent as auxiliary forces to your main units, but they are slow to move from place to place.
Attack the target from where you are standing.
Move closer and attack the target.
You may randomly get a small bit of bonus damage when you fire.
To attack noncombatants, use the Slayer ability or other specialized attack style.
Use 1 Action Point and 1 Mental Energy to speed up construction of this structure.
The selected unit is unable to assist this target.
This unit would need {0} Engineering Skill to boost this structure. It only has {1}.
The selected unit is unable to speak with this target. Requires Mental Energy.
You don't know how to rescue this kind of target yet. Are there any Contemplations that might be relevant?
The selected unit is unable to rescue this target. Requires Mental Energy.
You're not in the mood to attack the homeless. It would start a whole thing with the Citizen Advocates. You don't want that kind of trouble right now.
You're not in the mood to attack them. You're more interested in what they have to say.
If you're going to kill them, you want to do that face to face. You want to hear them speak first, anyway.
You're not in the mood to attack the humans you shelter.
Your shell company unit cannot attack this target without drawing suspicion to your whole operation.
That target is only after your shell company; your regular units intervening would give away your tower's connection to your shell company.
Above Target With Extra Weakness To Attacks From Above
Behind Target With Extra Weakness To Attacks From Rear
Android Leaping From Beyond Attack Range

lang.translation_notes: This is the text that pops up above a target that has been escaped death.
This is the text that pops up above a target that has been non-lethally taken-down.
This is how much a human target is being hit by a taser if they are not outright taken down.
This is how much a target is having their weapons disrupted by a player attacking them.
This is how much a target hacker is being weakened by a player attacking them.
This is used when non-fighter units run away at the first sign of violence.

For East-Asian fonts where you can write out 'searching for infiltrator' with just a few characters, that is likely to be more clear. For even English, I have to abbreviate more. This is an enemy searching for your stealth unit, and the {0} is how much damage they do to your stealth unit.

This is an enemy that has just been attacked by a non-stealth unit of yours, while the enemy was normally searching for your stealth unit, and they are quickly raising an alarm which damages your stealth unit more. The {0} is how much damage they do to your stealth unit.
This is specifically a case where an enemy hacker is trying to break in through your network/cyber-security defenses. {0} is how much damage they did to the target.
Enemies have stolen military secrets from YOU!

lang.text: Always check the stats of enemies you are seeing for the first time; any light blue-green entries are exploitable.
Always check the stats of enemies you are seeing for the first time; any reddish entries are important.

lang.translation_notes: This is show at the end of a list that has too many things. So 'A, B, C, D, +5 More' or similar.
{0} will be a custom thing for the player, but is often the Ctrl key.
{0} will be a custom thing for the player, but is often the Ctrl key. {1} will be the name of a kind of internal robotics.

lang.text: {0}+click to go to input/output screen for this resource.
lang.translation_notes: {0} will be a custom thing for the player, but is often the Ctrl key.

lang.text: Stance determines how this unit will act. However, the main way to adjust options is through abilities.
Bulk androids act on their own based on their stance. They can be repositioned manually, but everything else is automatic.
Jobs define a machine structure's function.
This unit will be marked defective and become a target for Military and SecForce guards.
Predicted Attack Of Opportunity To Your Unit
Damage This Unit Will Take Next Turn

lang.translation_notes: Trying to keep this as brief as possible is really helpful for readability. The other information about this being incoming damage is in other parts, so just conveying that this is for the next turn is enough.

lang.text: Your unit is likely to die next turn if this is your final action.
Your unit is likely to die next turn if it stays here.
The enemies sighting your unit will kill it if you attempt to move out of their range.
The enemies sighting your unit might kill your unit if you attempt to move out of their range.
The enemies sighting your unit will damage it if you attempt to move out of their range.
This unit will die next turn if nothing changes.
Enemies may attack your units here if they are not stealthed or blending in.

lang.translation_notes: {0} will be some positive number or zero. This is the amount of resources you're predicted to have net per turn with whatever is being proposed.
{0} will be some negative number. This is the amount of resources you're predicted to have net per turn with whatever is being proposed.
Will be used like 'In Storage: 452' or similar. This refers to how much of a resource already exists in storage.
Will be used like 'Available Storage: 5000' or similar. This refers to how much room the player has to store more of a resource of this kind.

lang.text: This action cannot be done by a vehicle.
This action cannot be done by a mech.
This action cannot be done by a bulk android.
This action cannot be done by this kind of unit.
You must first select one of your units.
Enemies would attack your units here, but this one has a high enough clearance to pass unnoticed.
Engineering skill allows units to self-repair faster.
If all your androids die, your consciousness will collapse. Having spares is not a bad plan.

You already have {0} androids, which collectively use {1} out of your {2} android capacity. This is the maximum your mind can support right now. Adding this further android would increase your usage by {3}, which is too much.

You only have a single android online. If it dies, your consciousness will collapse regardless of how many vehicles or mechs you have. Exercise extra caution. If your consciousness collapses, you'll fail this timeline.
At present, you only have {1} android capacity. You will have to scrap excess. Until the excess is corrected, none of your androids can act.
{0} here to open a list of units to quickly scrap them.
You only have {1} mech capacity right now. You will have to scrap any excess. Until this excess is corrected, none of your mechs can act.
You only have {1} vehicle capacity right now. You will have to scrap any excess. Until this excess is corrected, none of your vehicles can act.

Based on your current computing resources, you only have {1} of bulk squad capacity. You are currently using {0}. You will have to scrap any excess. Until this excess is corrected, none of your bulk units can act.

Based on your current computing resources, you only have {1} of captured unit capacity. You are currently using {0}. You will have to scrap any excess. Until this excess is corrected, none of your captured units can act.
In this timeline, your consciousness collapsed and did not recover. You will have to move to a different timeline.

lang.translation_notes: These are non-guard NPC combatants, but that is wordy and confuses the issue. Technically npc combat-capable troops who are just guarding are not really combatants right now, in one sense.

lang.text: {0} to cycle through structures with any issue.
When you have a specific unit or building selected, panning may be locked. {0} empty space to deselect your current selection.
Hold LMB and move the mouse to rotate/tilt the camera.
Alternatively, you can use {0} to rotate the camera, and {1} to tilt the camera.
Right Stick to rotate and tilt the camera.
Rotating the camera is important! Units and other small objects may be obscured behind buildings.
Also important, although most of your time will likely be spent at middle zoom.
You can select enemy units to then hover their stats in the bottom-left of the screen.
{0} to give orders to units or cancel menus.

This is what you use to build structures, place units, move units, tell a unit to take an action, and anything else a unit might do. If a menu is open that prevents giving orders to units or build orders, then this instead closes the menu.
Press {0} to open the next notification, go to your next unit, or start the next turn.
Any of your units that are unable to act further this turn will be skipped.
To quickly find and select those units, you can use the Forces sidebar (hotkey {0}).
If all of your units are out of Action Points (AP), or you are out of Mental Energy, then pressing this will advance to the next turn.
Any tooltip that can be expanded will say so in small print at the bottom. Try it with this one!
Want even more information about a stat? Click the unit, and then hover over that stat in the bottom left corner.

lang.translation_notes: This is using the asterisk kind of like a footnote below a different header, to make sure the player notices this.

lang.text: Other hotkeys are shown in tooltips
Hover here for some handy ones
Most major interfaces have a shortcut noted on the tooltip for their button.
{0} to customize the loadout of the selected unit's type.
Hold {0} to enable Inspect Mode for examining buildings.
Hold {0} to show a longer version of many tooltips.
{0} to toggle a view of recent activity.
Unit is busy with an action-over-time.
You must open the message above this menu before you can end this turn.
All NPC units need to finish acting first.
Press {0} to select the next NPC unit, so that it, and any others that come into view, will act. Don't be shy about pressing {0}, as it will not end your turn unfairly.
You are {0} over your mech capacity. Scrap the excess before any of the others will be able to act.
You are {0} over your android capacity. Scrap the excess before any of the others will be able to act.
You are {0} over your vehicle capacity. Scrap the excess before any of the others will be able to act.
Unit is out of action points (AP) for this turn.
Costs {0} action points (AP), but this unit has {1} remaining for this turn.
Costs {0} mental energy, but you have {1} remaining this turn.
This ability can only be used at a building (your unit would be standing above it).
This ability cannot be used while riding in a vehicle. Deploy the unit first.
This unit is already taking cover.
This unit already has its shields up.
You Are Out Of Mental Energy For This Turn

lang.translation_notes: Header for a subsection of construction that is things like how much electricity or deterrence it needs in that area.
Header for a subsection of construction that is things like how much electricity it provides.

This is a label for how many workers and residents of the lower and working class are here. In the US, we call the working class the 'middle class,' but for those who follow British norms, the middle class is something else much higher than this -- a leisure class.
This is a label for how many workers and residents of the upper class are here.

lang.text: Activating this ability will allow you to choose a target. {0} to choose the target.
Activating this ability will allow you to choose a location to move to. {0} to choose the location.
Activating this ability puts you into a different mode. Keys and buttons work normally in that mode, but you'll see different options.
You haven't invented anything suitable for this vehicle to construct yet!
When a unit is in standby, it will not be in the normal selection rotation from pressing {0}, but it will still be selectable by pressing {1}.

Standby is for focusing on smaller groups. There is no difference in unit functionality. Putting all of your units into standby has no effect on the {0} key. This prevents muscle memory from betraying you. To skip straight to the next turn, press the {1} key.
{0} to toggle standby for one turn. {1} to toggle indefinite standby.
There are no damaged units or structures in range.
There are no units in range that you can force into conversation.
Damage Negation From Net Control Skill
Attack Power Added From Net Control Skill
This unit already has max AP.
You must have at least two Energy to use this.

lang.translation_notes: How many units will be hit by an ability. Not in a nice way.
How many buildings will be burned down by an ability.

lang.text: Carry out a hack automatically. Useful when you want to keep in the flow of combat.
Cost increased because hack resistance is {0}x more than your hacker's skill.
lang.translation_notes: {0} is a floating-point number.

lang.text: Invade the enemy computer system yourself. A lot cheaper when enemy hack resistance is higher than your hacker's innate skill, and slightly cheaper in other circumstances. Also yields minor bonus resources.
It seems like an important ability goes here, but you're not in the mood to think about it just now.

lang.translation_notes: This goes on its own line as a header, identifying the subject of the tooltip as being a 'Feat.' Please see the related handbook entry.
This goes on its own line as a header, identifying the subject of the tooltip as being a 'Perk.' Please see the related handbook entry.
This goes on its own line as a header, identifying the subject of the tooltip as being a 'Badge.' Please see the related handbook entry.
This goes on its own line as a header, identifying the subject of the tooltip as being a 'Temporary Status Effect.' Please see the related handbook entry.

lang.text: Whenever one of these jobs finishes installing, it will cause a burst of rage from an enemy faction. They will strike you... somewhere.
One Wave Will Launch On Build
Whenever one of these jobs finishes installing, a single wave of enemies will attack that location, even if you have enough deterrence to keep them away after that.
Required Staff To Provide Passive Effects

lang.translation_notes: This goes on a part of the interface where it needs one or two short words. It can simply be Deploy if that word is long in your language. It should be a target for LQA testing. It's something players will see a lot.

lang.text: You cannot build on Ziggurats until you have reached either Chapter 4, or Intelligence Class 7.
You cannot build off of the starting rock until you have created at least four timelines.

lang.translation_notes: Noun. Any encrypted data, it's non-specific.

lang.text: <color=#ABC2FF>{0}/{1}</color> Turns To Prepare For Enemy Arrival

lang.translation_notes: Charges as in explosive charges. {2} is the type of building where they are being set.
Burning down buildings. {2} is the type of building being burned down.
Destroying enemy units.
People going to/from work. Players can actually use nonlethal means, including just scaring them off, and this still counts.
Players can actually use nonlethal means, including just scaring them off, and this still counts.
{0} is the name of the investigation to complete. This is in the imperative form.

lang.text: Perform A Successful Extraction On An Enemy

lang.translation_notes: Will say either left-click or right-click or similar.
Will say either left-click or right-click or similar.
Will say either left-click or right-click or similar.
Will say either left-click or right-click or similar.
Keep as brief as possible, ideally. This will be a keybind like Ctrl that shows here.

lang.text: Cannot delete the source of your network.
lang.translation_notes: This is referring either to the network tower, or the emergency network source.
{0} is the name of some building.

lang.text: Cannot scrap unit engaged in an action-over-time.

lang.translation_notes: Will say either left-click or right-click or similar.

lang.text: The selected structure will be built inside your choice. You may need to zoom out and scroll around -- or use the map!
The above is the absolute maximum number of more times this action can be done. If the project ends before you hit that cap, all actions related to the project become unavailable.
Complete projects to gain more inspiration points for research domains.
Equipment is instantly applied. This is how long this equipment slot for this unit type will be blocked from any further changes after this equipment is assigned to a slot.
Your current intelligence class is only {0}.
The ideas in this research domain are exhausted. More will open up at a higher intelligence class.

lang.translation_notes: 0 is the amount, 1 is the type of data. 'requires 10 intelligence', etc.

lang.text: Turn one of your ideas into an invention. Or seek new upgrades by exploring a research domain.
You'll need to maintain deterrence in the area. You may have a hard time finding host mining sites. Use the Navigation lens to find and inspect large mining sites (yellow triangles).

lang.translation_notes: A very brief way of noting to the player that the unit in question is occupied doing something already; it doesn't matter what, but the player would have to interrupt the unit to use them for something new.

lang.text: Vehicle Cannot Carry This Type Of Unit
No More Room For Units Of This Type
Location Is Too Far From Any Android Launcher
Location Is Too Far From Any Aerospace Hangar Or Mech-Launching Vehicles
Location Is Too Far From Any Aerospace Hangar
You Do Not Have The Resources To Build Another
You can place this bulk android squad, but once you do you'll experience mental overload. None of your bulk squads will function until you scrap one of the others.
You can place this android, but once you do you'll experience mental overload. None of your androids will function until you scrap one of the others.
You can place this mech, but once you do you'll experience mental overload. None of your mechs will function until you scrap one of the others.
You can place this vehicle, but once you do you'll experience mental overload. None of your vehicles will function until you scrap one of the others.
A unit can take as many actions as fit into its AP budget each turn. Unless otherwise specified, expending 1 AP also requires 1 Mental Energy.
You can use some AP from Unit A, and then some from Unit B, and then the rest from Unit A.
If a unit is engaged in an action over time, then no further actions can be taken by a unit until its action-over-time is completed.
